to force someone to do something: [ + to infinitive ] As a schoolboy he was compelled to wear shorts even in winter.formal The new circumstances compelled a change in policy. See also
compulsion (FORCE)
formal to produce a strong feeling or reaction: Over the years her work has compelled universal admiration and trust.
